p: There is however a growing awareness about the global burden of viral hepatitis and its impact on communities’ welfare. After the first resolution adopted in 2010 by the World Health Assembly which called for interventions for both prevention and control of viral hepatitis, WHO provided international guidelines for viral hepatitis screening and drew attention to this ‘urgent public health matter’. 1 8 In addition, following the Dakar Call in July 2011, 9 healthcare professionals (HCP) in Africa advocated for mobilisation to fight against viral hepatitis in the continent, and collaborations involving health professionals and societies of gastroenterologists continue to grow today.
